intro: Potamogeton × fluitans f. latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf pondweed, is a hybrid aquatic plant characterized by its broad, elongated leaves that are often floating or partially submerged. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and wetlands. Its leaves are usually green to reddish in color and can vary in width, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various water organisms.
